snippet: Officials at General Motors said an internal report on faulty ignition switches tied to 13 deaths would exonerate the company’s chief executive.
abstract: General Motors officials increasingly believe that chief executive Mary T Barra will be cleared of wrongdoing and survive crucial internal investigation of recall; say that soon-to-be-published internal report on faulty ignition switches tied to 13 deaths, which will name those responsible and recommend changes, is expected to exonerate Barra.
lead_paragraph: Officials at General Motors said an internal report on faulty ignition switches tied to 13 deaths would exonerate the company’s chief executive.

headline.main: G.M. Officials Say They Expect Mary Barra Will Be Cleared of Wrongdoing
headline.print_headline: G.M. Officials Say They Expect Chief Will Be Cleared of Wrongdoing
